oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertisement from Nashville City Directory, 1871
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement of the Western & Atlantic Railroad Company, published in the 1871 Nashville City Directory. The President was Joseph E. Brown. The General Superintendent of the company was Col. E.W. Cole, a former Confederate officer who became a railroad tycoon. The 137-mile line between Atlanta and Chattanooga was built in 1841-50 by the State of Georgia at a cost of almost five million dollars. It was a foundation for Atlanta’s emergence as a rail center and the W&A became a primary link in the chain of Southern railroads connecting the Atlantic Ocean and the Mississippi River. Forms part of Nashville City Directory Collection, Metro Archives. 1 digital image.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cole, E. W. (Edward William), 1832-1918; Brown, Joseph E. (Joseph Emerson), 1821-1894
